page.title: 19Customs
page.content: Every year around the beginning of July the Seamer Fair takes place.This coincides with the reading of the Charter.It has taken place since 1383. It used to be the most important event in the area.Because the fair was so important the Burgesses of Scarborough supressed it in 1612.It was revived again in 1813,1814 & 1815 and shows were held in the village for horses, cattle and sheep.By the year 1850 it had been restricted to a two day event just to sell horses.To add excitement the Gypsies started to attend.But unfortunately in 1911 they caused a disturbance.After this they only went to Seamer on fair days.Soon after the fair became a time of fun and sport. The Charter is read at 11am on Saint Swithens Day & people still gather by the old Toll House & children run for pennies thrown by the Lord of Seamer.
